title: LIA: Supervised Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models for Automatic Issue Assignment
data:
A Khosravani, A Hosseinpour, A Akhavan, M Keshani- arXiv preprint arXiv, 2026
Issue assignment is a critical process in software maintenance, where new issue 
reports are validated and assigned to suitable developers. However, manual issue 
assignment is often inconsistent and error-prone, especially in large open-source 
projects where thousands of new issues are reported monthly. Existing automated 
approaches have shown promise, but many rely heavily on large volumes of project-
specific training data or relational information that is often sparse and noisy, which
Cites: Back to the Basics: Rethinking Issue-Commit Linking with LLM

title: Abductive Vibe Coding
data:
L Murphy, AA Babikian, M Chechik- arXiv preprint arXiv:2601.01199, 2026
When software artifacts are generated by AI models (" vibe coding"), human 
engineers assume responsibility for validating them. Ideally, this validation would be 
done through the creation of a formal proof of correctness. However, this is infeasible 
for many real-world vibe coding scenarios, especially when requirements for the AI-
generated artifacts resist formalization. This extended abstract describes ongoing

Cites: Automatic Programming: Large Language Models and Beyond

data:

software engineering (SE) research. While artifact sharing is now a standard practice 
and even expected at premier SE venues such as ICSE, the practical usability of

title: System-Level Evaluation of Advanced Rowhammer Attacks on Deployed Mitigations
data:
P Jattke - 2025
The security of today's computing systems is multifaceted, involving software, 
hardware, and human factors. Hardware security has long been overlooked, but 
modern attacks like Meltdown, Spectre, and Rowhammer are a serious concern due 
to their practical exploitability and difficulty in mitigating devices in the wild. 
Rowhammer is particularly insidious as it exploits a fundamental physical property of 
DRAM technology, making its root cause hard to fix. With DDR4 DRAM, vendors
Cites: Directed greybox fuzzing

title: Protean: A Programmable Spectre Defense
data:
N Mosier, H Nemati, JC Mitchell, C Trippel
We present the PROTEAN Spectre defensethe first to be altogether 
comprehensive, covering all side-channels and speculation; programmer-
transparent, requiring no source modifications; and programmable, tailoring its 
hardware protections to software's security needs. Several Spectre defenses offer the 
first two features, but protect a hardware-defined subset of architectural state from 
transiently leaking. Meanwhile, many Spectrevulnerable programs process secrets in
Cites: oo7: Low-overhead defense against spectre attacks via program

title: Refining Code Coverage to Better Reflect Fuzzing Performance
data:
S Lipp - 2025
Fuzzing is a testing technique that executes the software with malformed inputs to 
uncover vulnerabilities. Traditional metrics like code coverage treat all code as 
equally important and can, therefore, lead to inaccurate fuzzing assessments. This 
thesis introduces a novel vulnerability-oriented metric that focuses on the covered, 
potentially vulnerable code to better reflect the efficiency and effectiveness of fuzzing. 
bersetzte Kurzfassung: Fuzzing ist eine Testtechnik, bei der die Software mit
